sitesParagraph1: SunnieJS 3 is a multisite environment, this means that in a single environment we are able to manage several web portals simultaneously, each with its own features and settings.
sitesParagraph2: Each of the sites is composed of different pages and these, in turn, are filled with components placed from the distribution defined by a layout. Additionally, each site has an associated appearance theme which gives it its overall style and structure.
sitesParagraph3: For this, each site has a sitemap.json file where all the site settings are defined. Of course, it is not necessary to manage it manually but through the CMS tools it can be managed automatically for add pages, move them from the site in the navigation tree, manage the components that form them, their appearance theme or the layout that each page uses.
sitesParagraph4: If you prefer, you can also edit the sitemap manually but do not forget after compiling the site so that your changes are reflected in the browser. We recommend you not to edit the sitemap by hand as it can be complex and it is easy to make a mistake in the syntax or format.
sitesParagraph5: From the sitemap, you can indicate for each page the components that it includes, its configuration, in what position Go, what are the metadata of the page and much more!
sitesParagraph7: The site object defines both the name of the site and the URL with which we will access.
sitesParagraph8: The pages object defines all the pages available to the site as well as its configuration.
